reviews.review_msg: I honestly do not even know what happened in that class. After the first week everything was based off of a statistical software that he expected you to be fluent in. He understands the material, however it did not translate to being able to teach it well. Reads off the slides which make no sense at all.

This course was absolutely disastrous. For people who have a good Stats background, this is no problem. For someone (like me) who doesn't have good background in "R", which is the language you use for this course, he doesn't even go over the basics and glances over the main ideas. Awful marker and his exams go TOO detailed to test big idas. AVOID.

Seems like a great guy and professor for Statistics students, however, as a HSCI student, I was lost and felt like he and other stats students in the class were always 10 steps ahead of us students who aren't as well versed in math/statistics. Again, good guy, cares about stats, but STAT sfu courses not t all that accessible. Had to teach myself

Had him for STAT 305/STAT 341. Brad should set the standard for teachers everywhere. Great notes, fair but challenging tests, is organized, has office hour at a reasonable time and makes lecture useful though not mandatory. He can answer 99% of student questions and really knows the material. He even knows he is boring->rare jokes. Beware his MCQs.

It's not difficult if put in the effort to understand the material. It helps to understand it during homework so you won't have to cram for the exams and to not rely too much on the cheat sheet. Not hard to get a B+ or A- just don't slack and go to class. He talks fast but if you keep up his lectures are pretty helpful
Brad is a nice prof. he is very helpful and good at teaching.

Still not sure why I wasted good money to be taught by someone who should have never been allowed to teach in the first place. Never comes to a comprehensible point, wastes time on insignificant details at the expense of actually explaining what the concepts are or how to use them. A joke of a class, avoid Jorge at all costs. You have been warned.

This class was not organized and the prof couldn't explain the concepts well. Going to class is a waste of time so it's better to study on your own. The material is interesting and not hard to understand by reading the textbook or watching some youtube videos. His exams were not hard if you understood the material and cheat sheets are allowed.

If they let me give him a 0 rating, I would. He was disorganized without fail, his lectures never made sense, his practice material was inconsistent with what he taught, he wrote the final THE. NIGHT. BEFORE. OUR. 8:30AM. EXAM. He is more than just a bad prof - the department did nothing even with proof of how bad things were. #theydontcareaboutyou
He don't know how to teach stat. stat 305 should be an easy course, but the midterm 2 average was 50%. Don't take with him!!!!!
bad bad bad prof, this is my first semester and I have wanted to leave school because Jorge, don't take this course with any reason!!!!!!!!!!

I cannot fit into 350 characters how awful he was a professor. This class is honestly as safety hazard, attending made me want to yeet myself of the mountain. Had to teach myself the whole course using the textbook and khan academy. Anyways if you love yourself don't take stats with Jorge.<3

The worst prof ever, i could not understand anything in his lecture, 2/3 of students skip his lectures. His lecture notes are aweful too, he had data from R but did not tell how to get them, very unorganized. Just avoid him or he will ruin your grade

Avoid at all cost. Inconsistently replies to emails, rude to students when you try to ask questions. Midterm average was 40%, nearly 2/3 of the class failed. Our class had to get the faculty head to sit in on one of our lectures to prove how bad Prof. Rodriguez is. Currently in the process of working with the Uni Ombudsman to try to fix this mess.

Takes him forever to reply to emails (especially when it's about an exam). He never listens to his students' suggestions. He posted the study guide for M2 a few days before the exam. M2 didn't involve probability but his guide had half probability q's (said he didn't want to revise the doc & essentially was too lazy to make up relevant questions).

Not a good prof at all. Horrible teaching, isn't accessible at all, seems to not care for his students. Doesn't post notes until minutes before class, doesn't post assignments until they're due in less than a week, and often selectively replies emails. His exams and assignments are poorly worded. DO NOT TAKE STATS WITH HIM!

Absolutely horrendous teaching quality and style. I don't understand why any school would hire him as an educator as he clearly has zero clue what he is doing in an educational setting. Makes typos on all lecture notes and assignment questions. Exam irrelevant to materials. One of the worst profs I've encountered in 4+ years. Just no.

Don't. My advice: grab onto the nearest backpack and naruto run your way out of making this bad decision. He's awful. I used to be sane before taking his class. Gives awful lectures; very irrelevant tests compared to the questions done in class. Designed an exam where almost every student left the last two pages (20 marks) blank due to time limit.
I have no clue what he is talking about in class. He is very unorganized and his exams are not even relevant to his lecture notes. Never try to take his class. Run away please.

Jorge has been the worst professor I have ever had in my 4 years of university. He seems like a nice guy, but teaching isn't for everyone. He doesn't know how to convey course material clearly, he's very disorganized, always leaves the class wondering what's going on, and his exams and assignments are very confusing. Avoid if you can.

The other reviews say it all. Completely disorganized, I've been teaching myself through the textbook and still don't know what to expect from Jorge. Lectures teach little to nothing, refuses to answer any and all questions in class. Very little clarity. Avoid at all cost, quite literally the worst class I've had to endure.
Not even being dramatic, this was the worst experience of my life.

Run fast. Run far. Showed up 40 min late to class because he "forgot" the time it started. Most disorganized class ever with minimal direction on what to study/what you're being tested on. Seems confused by any questions about .. anything. Poor quality of instruction and super vague about everything. Don't make the same mistake I did. Please. Run.

Class overall was pretty straightforward. 2 midterms and a final, with lots of bonus questions for extra marks in each one. Be sure to do lots of practice questions, prepares you for the exams. He's a really nice prof and tries to be funny which is nice.

Professor Davis is an excellent educator. His lectures were informative, engaging, and it was obvious he was enthusiastic about not only teaching, but getting you to understand the core concepts. He went above and beyond for outside class assistance. I can't recommend this professor enough, he was an important part of my SFU experience.
Prof was very unprepared for lectures. All he does is put animal photos on our notes, so useless. He skipped over main concepts and STAT 305 overall was just very disorganized.
He's funny and approachable. Very patient and makes sure we understand what he's saying. Would definitely recommend!!!
Terrible in general
Do yourself a favour and wait for someone else to teach the course!!!!

One of the worst among bad profs at SFU. There is frankly, no teaching. She reads slides to you without demonstrating problems and assumes you understand what is going on. Forget about asking her for help. Ditch lecture and either teach yourself or go to the stat workshop.

I think she could do better at teaching the material but, the course is not hard and you can study the notes on your own and you'll be fine. Exams are very similar to the practice midterm and you're allowed a formula sheet on exams. I got some help during her office hours and she was very sweet.

Absolutely useless professor! Do not take a class with her! She is completely overwhelmed with technology and the material in the course. Reads lines of R code in lectures which will not be tested on any exam. When you try to go to her for help she turns you away even after you explicitly said that you are unable to attend her office hour for help.

Course was extremely easy, but Jinko was about as useful as a potato. Honestly just read the notes and you'll be fine. Most of the material covered you would have learned in previous stat course or can use common sense to figure it out. Don't waste your time going to class unless you need someone to read to you.

The course was fine but would have been much easier if I didn't have to teach myself. I felt as though I could not go to her to be able to ask questions and the lectures actually confused me more than made me learn. The practice tests she posted were very helpful and organized but did not assign more questions with solutions for us to practice.

This is a 3rd year course. Profs dont guide students through everything, at this point we are expectd to know how to do things ourselves! I found the course to be very clear and fairly graded. The midterms had an average of about 70. Lecture notes were clear and prof promply answered questions on Canvas. If you can self teach you will do well!

HORRIBLE professor. Avoid this class with Jinko if possible. She frustrated all the time and is not helpful what so ever. Assignments are useless because they are done on R (which isn't used for the midterms or the final). She has never ones gone over hand written examples in class.

deserves the award for most useless prof to ever exist. her notes are worded weirdly with lots of mistakes. very defensive whenever her methods are questioned and does not seem to care whether students feel prepared for exams or not. assignments and exam material are disconnected. gives passive aggressive answers on canvas discussion page
The lecture slides that she provides are clear and sufficient to do well in the course, but her execution in the actual lecture is meh.

STAY AWAY. If you see her as the prof for any class, DO NOT TAKE IT. She is the worst lecturer and does not explain things well at all. She just reads off her slides and is EXTREMELY defensive when it comes to answering questions. She expects you to know everything and won't answer you properly if you have a questions that "you should know already"

All she does in class is talk about stupid R software (which doesn't even help u for the assignments) plus it's not on the midterms. She never actually shows u ANY useful examples in lecture. Assingments are hard as hell since it's all about software coding. She can't teach at all her lectures are a mess so no point in going. Avoid this class!!

She makes a lot of mistakes on her slides and steps that it could cost you if you dont crosscheck with the book or catch her mistakes during lecture. Youre better off self-studying from the book or monopolizing Stats Workshop TAs for better clarity than during lectures.

The prof is hard to follow. She talks to the projector screen and is not clear about what she is pointing at. There are a lot of blank stares in each class. You will learn more from your textbook then going to class.
I am graduating and going back through all my favorite professors  - of which Darby is definitely one.

I've taken a few courses since Stat 305 and the more prof's I'm with, the more I appreciate Darby. I liked coming in class and still remember what I learned even though I expected I'd hate statistics. Does anyone know if he's still teaching on campus? I'd love to see that silver fox again and am sure he'd like seeing me too. Just that kind of guy.
He was the best teacher I ve ever had in my life.

Stat 305 was actually ok! I thought it would be way harder. Darby makes it fun, he is very approachable, the quizzes and final are fair if you have been doing the assignments... and yes, he is definitely pleasant to look at! Take his class!

Dr Loughin was a fantastic professor. I never liked stats but I had to take this course for my degree and he truly made me enjoy stats and want to pursue more. He was kind, funny, and engaging in class. His exams were very fair based on the material he taught and homework was easy. Def go to class, it's better than the recordings. Highly recommend!

Tom is one of those professors you rarely have at SFU. He is engaging, funny, and an incredibly good prof. Exams were mostly about understanding major concepts and applying that to questions, with open book/open notes. There is R work and weekly homework, but code is always provided in the lecture modules.

Overall a good prof and a class I probably would've really been interested in. Had to withdraw early in the semester because with a full course load it was practically impossible to do all of the homework plus all of the R coding. Would recommend the prof but beware of the course if you're not very computer-savvy.

Tom is one of the best profs I have had! His lectures are as engaging as possible, given it is a stats course and he clearly explains concepts. He is very approachable and ready to explain answers to any questions in a variety of ways until the student understands. Exams were fair, he gave R scripts ahead of time which allowed them to analyze them.

Super nice guy. The whole class did terribly on all the exams and he found ways to scale our marks up a ton. Homework assignments were barely related to the exams and took forever though. There were also literally no practice questions for the exams so we had no idea what to expect. Probably why the averages were at 50%.

Not an easy class and I think he was decent given the circumstances. All of our lectures were pre-recorded. He makes his own notes and exams. I think he did a good job explaining the statistics concepts that were most important and relevant for the exams. It just sucked that he didn't give us ANY practice exam questions

Prof Liang is very kind to her students. Her tests are fair, just do the practice exams, past hws for review, and read some parts of the textbook and you'll do fine. She uploads slides with her notes which is awesome.

Liang is a new prof+she's NICE. However, she goes really slow in class+repeats herself in lecture to be CLEAR. Most students complain about not being able to understand her but trust me, she speaks fine. I mean she attended grad school in McGill.  She's kind in that she provides practice exams. No need for text, just show up and understand slides.
it's a easy course!!! take it. Dr wang perhaps is not the best prof in stat, but she is super kind. the practice midterm and final are very useful.
she is very kind and hard  working. but the final is very hard. i do understand that this is her first semester in SFU but she really need improve her teaching skill.

Liangliang is a good prof though her expression is not that clear. Her midterms are pretty easy and straightfoward. As long as you do the practice questions, you will do well in the exam. And the average of this course is high.

It is her first time ever teaching a class in a university this semester. She is very unclear when she explains, very boring, very dry. You pretty much teach everything to yourself, she reads off her PowerPoint slides and does not give many examples at all, just lists rules for formulas. Barely anyone attends her lectures, worst prof I've ever had.
Great lecturer! very engaging. The exam questions reflected your effort on the homework. Make sure you do all the homework.

One of the best profs I ever had. She is very knowledgeable and cares about her students. Her lectures and lecture slides are very clear and easy to understand. Some assignments + 2 midterms + 1 final, Exams were reasonable but you definitely need to study for them and keep up with the course material. Getting an A in this class is not difficult.

One of the best profs I've ever had. Midterms and final exams had no surprises and we were only tested on things that were taught. I struggled in stat 203 but 305 was by far way easier and Sonja did an excellent job at making sure her lessons were simplified and easy to understand.

sonja is the best prof ive had in my entire undergrad. she is so thoughtful and an amazing lecturer. she only tests you on things she has taught in class, there is no surprises. to better prep for exams, do the assignments and quizzes again and you will be set because they are so similar.

Wonderful professor. Haven't had a professor I was this pleased to be a student. Carefully review the quizzes, and prepare the cheat sheet and you will be spot on. She provides the lecture code with lots of detail so that assignments are very easy and she is very accessible for extra help. Thanks Sonja! :)
Best prof in the whole dang stats department.

Sonja is the best prof in stat. If you have the chance to take any of her classes please do! She explains the concept very well and makes difficult concepts easier for students. She is very friendly and caring. Whenever you have questions, she is always there for you! Always replies messages rapidly. I took both stat 201 and 305 with her. Amazing!
Take this class with Sonja Isberg. In fact, take any statistics course you can with Sonja Isberg. STAT305 was actually so much fun for me personally because of the amazing professor teaching it.
A truly amazing prof!

this is for stat 201, this prof is goated. she is so amazing and teaches w ease. super mellow-toned which makes it nice to listen to LMAO. tests you on what she has taught there are no surprises and she truly wants her students to succeed. take any class w her I don't think you'll be disappointed.
Oops my last post was actually for STATS201!! Not stats305. TAKE STATS 201 WITH HER SHES THE BESTTT

Best teacher EVER. She teaches so clearly anyone, even my little cousins could understand her lectures. On our midterm we got to bring in a cheat sheet. She teaches sooooo well and makes the class very easy but you are still learning and understanding the material clearly. Take this as an elective/course with her if you can she is amazing.

I was extremely nervous going into this class, as Statistics is not my strongest suit. However, Sonja did an amazing job explaining difficult concepts and she did an amazing job providing examples that were easy to remember and relate to statistical topics. She is very caring and her assignments and exams are extremely fair.

Sonja is one of the best professors I have ever had, so sweet. Her lectures are easy to follow and listen to. She explains difficult concepts so well and makes statistics fun. Would definitely recommend her!

Sonja is the best professor I've ever had, period. She has the perfect mix of straightforward explanation and sassy humor in her lectures that makes you pay attention to what's going on. The online assignments are a piece of cake, because she covers all the necessary R code in the in-class modules. The exams are easy, and she's a sweetheart.

Sonja is the BEST prof I've had so far. Stats can be really confusing but she explains concepts really well, and gives plenty of examples. The lectures are easy to follow and the assignments and quizzes were really useful in learning, I'd highly recommend taking stats with Sonja if you have the option :)

I HIGHLY recommend taking stats with her! As someone who is not strong with stats, I find Sonja to be very lenient and clear when teaching important concepts, making sure students understand. Her Canvas course is easy to navigate and provides a lot of resources (recordings, annotated slides, specific textbook chapters, etc). Overall a great prof!

Sonja is such an amazing lecturer. She's so organized, great at explaining concepts, and clear about her expectations. Exams and assignments are very fair and she goes out of her way to make sure students are prepared. Also very accessible outside of class time. Overall just really amazing, definitely recommend!

Sonja is the BEST stats prof I have ever had! She's amazing at explaining concepts and repeats herself if she has to to make sure everyone understands. Very clear on what will be on tests/expectations. As someone who doesnt like stats, she is very fun to listen to!
What a caring prof! Love her!

As a non-math person, I found Dr. Pai's lectures to be clear and helpful. Dr. Pai focuses on going through practice problems during live lectures and posted videos, many of which are blueprints for assignment and exam questions. He takes time to answer student questions during lectures and office hours. Thank you Dr. Pai! Highly recommend!

Terrible experience, contradicts herself, I am not sure she knows what she is doing.  Unapproachable, had to redact many exam and assignment questions because she made errors or everyone got them wrong because of her poor lectures and lack of communication.

so unbelievable, avoid as much as possible. average for all exams was 50% because she didnt give us a formula sheet and didnt allow cheat sheets so ur on ur own for a STATISTICS class. not sure how she expected us to memorize everything. Wish i dropped out when I had the chance.

Absolutely awful, avoid her at all costs. Half the class failed the first midterm (which had multiple choice), so she decided to make the 2nd midterm and final fully written. Which understandably half the class failed the 2nd midterm and final exam. Not scaled or curved, and no cheat sheet or formula sheets given for exams.
